title: Ticket #4721: DAGman submit to same queue
description:
It would be nice if a running DAGman job could submit to the same queue that it is running under. Consider a server running two queues. The current behavior is that a scheduler universe job running on q2 will submit its jobs to q1. The ideal behavior is that it would submit to q2 unless explicitly told to do otherwise.

Sadly, patching this myself is beyond my skills, but I'd be happy to help however I can.
remarks:
2014-Nov-17 13:20:12 by wenger:
Hmm -- can you clarify a little bit? Are you saying that the job will always be submitted to the queue that's the one that's not running DAGMan? Or is there something about q1 that makes the jobs prefer it? In other words, is this symmetric or not?

2014-Nov-17 13:27:18 by wenger:
Or are you basically saying that if you specify 

  condor_submit_dag -schedd-address-file <file>

the -schedd-address-file specification should apply to the DAG's node jobs but doesn't?

2014-Nov-17 13:41:05 by bcotton:
DAGman currently always submits to Q1, regardless of which queue the condor_dagman job is running in. That's because we set SCHEDD_HOST in the config. Without SCHEDD_HOST set, DAGs submitted to Q2 won't successfully submit jobs at all.

  Or are you basically saying that if you specify condor_submit_dag -schedd-address-file <file> the -schedd-address-file specification should apply to the DAG's node jobs but doesn't?

Yes, ish. (-schedd-address-file doesn't seem to work in 8.2.3, as I recently noted on htcondor-users, and in this case we're not actually submitting with that argument, but via a submit file).

I can force the desired behavior by manually specifying _CONDOR_SCHEDD_HOST in the environment, but I'm not sure of a good way to automatically detect and set that (since the jobs are submitted dynamically by CycleServer and there's no way of knowing a priori where it will end up).

2014-Nov-17 13:55:05 by bbockelm:
Wouldn't it be reasonable to have _condor_SCHEDD_HOST automatically set by the schedd for all scheduler / local universe jobs (if not already set in the job?)?

2014-Nov-17 15:04:25 by wenger:
Ah, okay, you're saying that the node jobs go to whatever queue SCHEDD_HOST in the config is pointing to, no matter which queue the DAGMan job itself is submitted to, right?

2014-Nov-17 15:19:13 by bcotton:
That's correct. I've tried a variety of ways of forcing the issue (including setting SCHEDD.Q2.SCHEDD_ENVIRONMENT = "_CONDOR_SCHEDD_HOST=$(SCHEDD.Q2.SCHEDD_NAME)", SCHEDD_ENVIRONMENT = "_CONDOR_SCHEDD_HOST=$(SCHEDD_NAME)", and even using _CONDOR_SCHEDD_HOST=$$([regexps(""(.*)#(.*)#(.*)"",GlobalJobId,""\1"")]) in the job's environment setting), to no avail.

2014-Nov-17 17:12:20 by bcotton:
For what it's worth, specifying _CONDOR_SCHEDD_HOST=$$([regexps(""(.*)#(.*)#(.*)"",GlobalJobId,""\1"")]) in the submit file's environment setting would work except that such expansions happen in the shadow, so don't help for scheduler universe jobs. Here's a sample submit file: 

  # Template used by plugin rapipeline.prepare to generate the DAG submit file
  # for each submission. Parameters are configured in prepare.cfg.


  universe        = scheduler
  executable      = /usr/bin/condor_dagman
  output          = workflow.dag.lib.out
  error           = workflow.dag.lib.err
  log             = workflow.dag.dagman.log
  remove_kill_sig = SIGUSR1


  # attempts to ensure that DAGMan is automatically
  # requeued by the schedd if it exits abnormally or
  # is killed (e.g., during a reboot).
  on_exit_remove  = ( ExitSignal =?= 11 || (ExitCode =!= UNDEFINED && ExitCode >=0 && ExitCode <= 2))


  copy_to_spool   = False
  arguments       = "-f -l . -Debug 3 -Lockfile /var/log/condor/dagman.req-176.lock -AutoRescue 1 -DoRescueFrom 0 -Dag /data/raptest/submissions2/req-176/execute/workflow.dag -CsdVersion $CondorVersion:' '8.0.6' 'Feb' '01' '2014' 'BuildID:' '225363' '$"
  environment     = "_CONDOR_DAGMAN_LOG=/var/log/condor/dagman.req-176.out _CONDOR_MAX_DAGMAN_LOG=0 PATH=/usr/local/bin:/bin:/usr/bin CONDOR_CONFIG=/etc/condor/condor_config"


  +raPipelineSubmissionId = "req-176"
  +raPipelineSubmissionConfig = "http://192.168.53.128:8080/getConfig.s?templateName=rap3.5.0"
  +raPipelineSubmissionDir = "\\192.168.53.128\raptest\submissions2\req-176"
  +raPipelineSubmissionResultsDir = "\\192.168.53.128\raptest\results/raptest-2014.07.23-11.46.59-176-3_5_0_final_testing"
  +raPipelineStage="Risk Analysis Pipeline DAG"
  +cycleUser = "bcotton"
  +cycleGroup = "rap"
  +AccountingGroup = "g_rap.$(cycleUser)"


  queue 1

The above gets produced by a CycleServer plugin for submission via CycleServer. Since CycleServer doesn't have a way to submit DAGs via condor_submit_dag, we do it this way.
